Class Player

java.lang.Object
  Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

This class is to manipulate the information about each Player in a in a game of Yahtzee.

Each Player has a name and a score-sheet. The score sheet stores all information about the Player's game scores: it consists of score cells for Match.MAXGAMES games and CellCodes.GRANDTOTAL+1 cells within each game (from CellCodes.ONES to CellCodes.GRANDTOTAL).

The Evaluator class is responsible for calculating the values that get put into the Player's score cells.

HINT: the score-sheet is best implemented as a two-dimensional array, with the game number as the first index and the cell code as the second index. Recall from the CellCodes class that the CellCodes.ONES constant has the value zero, and that all other CellCodes constants are numerically ascending from zero to seventeen (CellCodes.GRANDTOTAL). Hopefully, this will make creating a score-sheet array easier.

Constructor Detail

Player

public Player(java.lang.String name)
Constructor for the Player.
  • All of the selected category score cells (from CellCodes.ONES to CellCodes.CHANCE) must be initialised to a negative value.

  • All of the total and bonus cells (from CellCodes.TOTALUS to CellCodes.GRANDTOTAL) must be initialised to zero.

Parameters:
name - the name of the player.
Method Detail

Instance method to return the name of the Player.

getScoreCell

public int getScoreCell(int game,
                        int cell)
Instance method to retrieve the value from a particular score cell.

Parameters:
game - the game number must be in the range from 0 to Match.MAXGAMES-1.
cell - the CellCode for the desired category in the score-sheet: must be in the range from CellCodes.ONES to CellCodes.GRANDTOTAL.

setScoreCell

public void setScoreCell(int game,
                         int cell,
                         int score)
Instance method to set the player's score or total for a particular cell.

Parameters:
game - must be in the range from 0 to Match.MAXGAMES-1.
cell - must be in the range from CellCodes.ONES to CellCodes.GRANDTOTAL.
score - the value to be assigned to the cell.
